Anthropic‚Äôs Jared Kaplan on the Future of AI Agents
| TechCrunch Sessions: AI | YouTube.com | June 6, 2025
Anthropic Co-Founder and Chief Science Officer Jared Kaplan joined TechCrunch Senior Reporter Max Zeff at our Sessions: AI event to talk about the hottest topic within the AI community right now: agents. In Kaplan‚Äôs view, chatbots are just the start, and agents will be the next frontier in expanding what AI can be capable of accomplishing. Kaplan also addressed a couple recent flashpoints with Anthropic, including the company rescinding some model access to the startup Windsurf, reportedly set to be acquired by OpenAI, as well as the company‚Äôs stance against some of the Trump admin‚Äôs recent AI policies.

News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Are AI Browsers The Future With Josh Miller
| WVFRM Podcast | YouTube.com | June 2, 2025
Josh Miller of The Browser Company joins Marques, Andrew, and David to discuss the evolution of web browsing through Arc, Dia, and the future impact of AI on browser technology.
B.)
Topaz Labs Launches Bloom, Innovative AI Image Upscaler With 5 Creativity Modes
| X.com | June 2, 2025
Today, we announce an entirely new class of image upscaler to the Topaz Labs lineup. Meet Bloom. Built for creatively upscaling AI images up to 8x, while adding stunning detail that‚Äôs both accurate to your input, and creative at the same time. Use 5 creativity modes from Subtle to Max and get 4 variations with just one click.
C.)
Character.AI Launches New Features For Enhanced Character Creation And Interaction
| Blog.character.ai | June 2, 2025
Today we unveiled a new suite of features to unlock your creative potential ‚Äî a bold evolution in how you engage with and create Characters. Character.AI started as 1:1 text chat and today we‚Äôre evolving to do so much more, inspired by what our users have told us they want to see on the platform. We‚Äôre expanding into a multi-modal world and unlocking even more ways for Creators to build immersive narratives and craft richer, more dynamic experiences.
D.)
Apple‚Äôs Chatbot Prototype Shows Promise But Struggles With Accuracy
| Macworld.com | June 2, 2025
With just one week to go until Apple opens its doors for WWDC 2025, sources suggest the event will be high on style and low on substance. With the company‚Äôs AI efforts falling under an unforgiving spotlight since it announced Apple Intelligence prematurely last June, next week‚Äôs keynote is likely to focus on sorting out (and talking up) the basics.
E.)
Jony Ive‚Äôs OpenAI Device Gets The Laurene Powell Jobs Nod Of Approval
| TheVerge.com | June 2, 2025
Laurene Powell Jobs has endorsed the mysterious AI device being developed by Jony Ive and OpenAI, highlighting her investment in Ive‚Äôs ventures and the potential for success mirroring that of the iPhone. The duo reflects on technology‚Äôs unintended consequences and aims to create a product that serves humanity‚Äôs needs more effectively.
June 10, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | June 10, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
June 9, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
The Top 5 AI Spy Operations That OpenAI Took Down
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 9, 2025
Grant Harvey outlines five sophisticated covert operations ‚Äî from North Korean faux-job schemes to Filipino political PR spam ‚Äî that were unraveled and shut down thanks to OpenAI‚Äôs AI usage monitoring. The report highlights both AI‚Äôs misuse by threat actors and its power in exposing them.
6.)
Veo 3 Unveils Veo 3 Fast: Over 2x Speed Boost in GeminiApp and Flow
| Josh Woodward on X | June 9, 2025
Veo 3 keeps growing like crazy. To keep up, we‚Äôre introducing Veo 3 Fast in @GeminiApp  and Flow. It‚Äôs >2x faster, has the same 720p resolution, and a bunch of serving optimizations. The big headline: we can serve more of it, even for the Yetis!
7.)
China Shuts Down AI Tools During Nationwide College Exams
| TheVerge.com | June 9, 2025
Major Chinese tech companies, including Alibaba, ByteDance, Tencent, and Moonshot, have temporarily disabled photo-recognition and answer-retrieval functions in their AI chatbots during the June 7-10 ‚Äúgaokao‚Äù college entrance exams to curb cheating and ensure fairness.
8.)
Advanced AI Suffers ‚ÄòComplete Accuracy Collapse‚Äô In Face Of Complex Problems, Study Finds
| TheGuardian.com | June 9, 2025
Apple researchers reveal that large reasoning models (LRMs) experience a sharp drop to zero accuracy ‚Äî termed a ‚Äòcomplete accuracy collapse‚Äô ‚Äî when tackling high-complexity puzzles, exposing fundamental scalability flaws in current AI and questioning paths toward artificial general intelligence.
9.)
UK Prime Minister, NVIDIA CEO Set The Stage As AI Lights Up Europe
| Blogs.nvidia.com | June 9, 2025
NVIDIA and the UK government unveil a suite of AI initiatives ‚Äî spanning sovereign compute labs, skills training, innovation sandboxes, and 6G collaboration ‚Äî to boost national AI capacity while orchestrating similar infrastructure and partnerships across Europe.
10.)
New Research Finds That AI Is Creating More Jobs And Higher Pay
| Inc.com | June 9, 2025
PwC‚Äôs 2025 AI Jobs Barometer shows that industries most exposed to AI have seen job growth in nearly every role, doubled wage increases, and productivity that‚Äôs quadrupled compared with slower-adopting firms. The study finds AI is expanding opportunities ‚Äî especially for non-degree workers ‚Äî and boosting pay, though ongoing reskilling remains critical.
11.)
Apple Punts On Siri Updates As It Struggles To Keep Up In The AI Race
| TheVerge.com | June 9, 2025
Apple‚Äôs WWDC 2025 introduced numerous ‚ÄúApple Intelligence‚Äù features ‚Äî translation, visual intelligence, ChatGPT integration ‚Äî while Siri was barely mentioned, with promised personalization updates delayed into next year amid concerns that Apple is falling behind OpenAI, Google and Microsoft in generative AI capabilities.
12.)
Ohio University Says All Students Will Be Required To Train And ‚ÄòBe Fluent‚Äô In AI
| TheGuardian.com | June 9, 2025
Here Ohio State University announced that all undergraduates must become fluent in AI through a curriculum-wide initiative that embeds generative AI skills, emphasizes responsible use and bans cheating, and supports faculty development along with a K‚Äî12 AI toolkit rollout.
13.)
Apple Intelligence Gets Even More Powerful With New Capabilities Across Apple Devices
| Apple.com | June 9, 2025
Here Apple announces at WWDC that its Apple Intelligence suite now includes on-device live translation across Messages, Phone and FaceTime, ChatGPT-powered image generation, Visual Intelligence for screen content insights, enhanced tools in Xcode, and a new developer-accessible Foundation Models framework ‚Äî all built with privacy at the core.
14.)
VisionOS 26 Introduces Powerful New Spatial Experiences For Apple Vision Pro
| Apple.com | June 9, 2025
Here Apple previews visionOS 26, bringing spatially anchored widgets and immersive scenes to Vision Pro, along with enhanced Personas, shared spatial experiences, support for 180¬∞/360¬∞ media from Insta360, GoPro and Canon, PlayStation VR2 controller compatibility, and new enterprise APIs for developers.
June 8, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
15.)
Almost Timely News: How Small Businesses Can Grow With AI
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | June 8, 2025
This episode provides small businesses with actionable AI strategies for growth, covering everything from strategic planning to content creation. Viewers will discover how AI tools can enhance research, marketing efforts, and website interactivity, enabling them to compete effectively with larger enterprises.
June 7, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
16.)
OpenAI Releases Enhanced Natural Voice Update for ChatGPT Paid Users
| OpenAI on X | June 9, 2025
We launched an update to Advanced Voice to make it way more natural and effortless to talk to. Now available to all paid users in ChatGPT.
17.)
Company Caught Faking AI, OpenAI‚Äôs New Free Tools, Insane New Video Generation, And Yeti ASMR
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | June 7, 2025
Recent events reveal a significant scandal involving a prominent AI company, alongside exciting new tool releases from OpenAI and Microsoft. The rapid advancements in AI technology, including innovative video generation solutions, are set against a backdrop of controversy and emerging trends in the ASMR community.
June 6, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
18.)
Here‚Äôs What Data AI Companies Keep On You
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 6, 2025
The article highlights how many AI companies retain user data even after deletion requests, particularly focusing on OpenAI‚Äôs recent court order to preserve all user conversations indefinitely. It also discusses the implications this order has for user privacy and data security, as well as the varying degrees of data collection among different AI platforms.
19.)
AI Accelerates: New Gemini Model + AI Unemployment Stories Analysed
| AI Explained | YouTube.com | June 6, 2025
Exploring the advancements of the Gemini 2.5 Pro, the discussion highlights its remarkable common-sense capabilities while acknowledging its limitations. Insights into Sundar Pichai‚Äôs perspective on AGI timelines and a critical analysis of AI-related unemployment concerns provide a comprehensive look at the evolving AI landscape.
20.)
Apple Rumored To Unveil Apple Intelligence Translation And AI Developer Tools At WWDC 2025
| AppleInsider.com | June 6, 2025
Apple is reportedly planning to announce new AI translation features and developer tools at WWDC 2025.
21.)
Microsoft Photos Adds AI-Powered Relight And Search Features On Windows 11
| Blogs.windows.com | June 6, 2025
Microsoft has introduced AI-powered Relight and enhanced search capabilities to the Photos app in Windows 11.
22.)
Google Introduces Scheduled Actions Feature In Gemini App
| Blog.google | June 6, 2025
Google‚Äôs Gemini app now supports scheduled actions, allowing users to automate tasks for future execution.
23.)
Anthropic Appoints Security Expert Richard Fontaine To Long-Term Benefit Trust
| Anthropic.com | June 6, 2025
Anthropic has named national security expert Richard Fontaine to its Long-Term Benefit Trust board.
June 5, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
24.)
Can You Trust Photos Anymore?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 5, 2025
The article examines the implications of advanced AI image editing tools like Flux1 and the ease of manipulating photos, raising concerns over authenticity in digital media. It also highlights recent legal developments involving AI companies and emphasizes the need for trust in online content.
25.)
Reddit Sues Anthropic For Stealing Data
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 5, 2025
Reddit initiates legal action against Anthropic, alleging unauthorized data usage. The lawsuit highlights concerns over data privacy and intellectual property in the evolving landscape of artificial intelligence.
26.)
Research: Tokasaurus: Stanford‚Äôs New AI Engine Makes Small Language Models Work Faster
| Scalingintelligence.stanford.edu | June 5, 2025
Stanford unveils Tokasaurus, a new AI engine designed to accelerate small language model performance.
27.)
Anthropic Limits Windsurf‚Äôs Claude AI Access Amid Rumors Of OpenAI Acquisition
| TechCrunch.com | June 5, 2025
Amid acquisition rumors, Anthropic restricts Claude AI use by Windsurf, citing competitive concerns.
28.)
Elevenlabs Releases Alpha Of Eleven V3, Enhanced Expressive Text-To-Speech Model
| Elevenlabs.io | June 5, 2025
Elevenlabs has launched the alpha version of Eleven V3, an upgraded model for expressive text-to-speech synthesis.
29.)
OpenAI Challenges NYT Data Demands To Protect ChatGPT User Privacy
| OpenAI.com | June 5, 2025
OpenAI has responded to The New York Times‚Äô data demands, defending the privacy of ChatGPT users.
30.)
Higgsfield AI Launches Higgsfield Speak For Motion-Driven Talking Videos
| X.com | June 5, 2025
Higgsfield AI debuts a new tool, Higgsfield Speak, enabling dynamic motion-driven talking videos.
31.)
Clairity Receives FDA Clearance For First AI Breast Cancer Risk Prediction Tool
| Fiercebiotech.com | June 5, 2025
Clairity has received FDA clearance for the first AI-powered tool to predict breast cancer risk.
32.)
X Introduces Policy Banning External Companies From Using Posts To Train AI Models
| TheVerge.com | June 5, 2025
X has updated its developer agreement to add a new restriction on using posts on the platform to train AI. The updated policy, spotted earlier by TechCrunch, says developers can‚Äôt use content from X or its API to ‚Äúfine-tune or train a foundation or frontier model.‚Äù
33.)
Google Releases Upgraded Preview Of Gemini 2.5 Pro AI Model Ahead Of General Availability
| Blog.google | June 5, 2025
We‚Äôre introducing an upgraded preview of Gemini 2.5 Pro, our most intelligent model yet. Building on the version we released in May and showed at I/O, this model will be the generally available, stable version starting in a couple of weeks, ready for enterprise-scale applications.
34.)
Anthropic Introduces Claude Gov AI Models For Us National Security
| Anthropic.com | June 5, 2025
We‚Äôre introducing a custom set of Claude Gov models built exclusively for U.S. national security customers. The models are already deployed by agencies at the highest level of U.S. national security, and access to these models is limited to those who operate in such classified environments.
35.)
Perplexity AI Integrates SEC Data For Enhanced Financial Insights
| X.com | June 5, 2025
Starting today, all Perplexity users have access to SEC data across Search, Research, and Labs. Our new SEC/EDGAR integration provides direct access to comprehensive financial data for all investors, making technical documents instantly understandable.
36.)
Heygen Announces Major Avatar IV Upgrade With Dynamic Gestures And Hyper-Real Expressions
| X.com | June 5, 2025
And you thought we were done with launches for the week ‚Ä¶ Avatar IV just got a major upgrade. Dynamic gestures based on your script. Gesture control via prompt. Hyper-real micro-expressions. 1080p video, 60 seconds long. Now available in all HeyGen accounts.
June 4, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
37.)
Build Your First AI Agent With Microsoft‚Äôs Free 1 Hour Course
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 4, 2025
Microsoft has launched a free one-hour course aimed at teaching users how to build AI agents. The course comprises ten concise lessons that guide learners through the fundamental tasks and tools needed to create sophisticated AI applications, emphasizing the importance of memories and tool use in AI development.
38.)
AI Will Not Cause Massive Unemployment
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 4, 2025
This discussion counters prevailing fears about AI-induced job losses, highlighting evidence that suggests job creation will keep pace with automation. Insights from industry leaders and studies are shared, emphasizing the potential for AI to transform, rather than eliminate, the workforce.
39.)
Introducing Eleven V3 (Alpha)
| Elevenlabs.io | June 4, 2025
Eleven V3 is an innovative Text to Speech model that enhances expressiveness and emotion in synthesized speech. It supports over 70 languages and allows for dynamic conversation generation through multiple speakers, making interactions sound natural and engaging.
40.)
Facing A Changing Industry, AI Activists Rethink Their Strategy
| Wired.com | June 4, 2025
AI Now Institute‚Äôs report highlights the concentration of AI power among a few companies and calls for advocacy groups to link AI issues with broader economic concerns, such as job security. It illustrates how tech activism can drive change and points out the challenges faced by regulators in implementing effective oversight.
41.)
Google DeepMind‚Äôs CEO Thinks AI Will Make Humans Less Selfish
| Wired.com | June 4, 2025
Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, expresses optimism that artificial general intelligence (AGI) could lead to a future of human flourishing and radical abundance. He believes that AGI will help solve critical global problems, alter societal behaviors toward cooperation, and ultimately reduce selfishness, but acknowledges the challenges and risks involved in its development.
42.)
Prompting Eleven V3 (Alpha)
| Elevenlabs.io | June 4, 2025
This guide provides effective techniques for prompting Eleven V3, focusing on voice selection, audio tags, and emotional control. Users are encouraged to experiment with various tags and voice settings to achieve optimal results, especially in multi-speaker dialogues and expressive outputs.
43.)
You‚Äôre Not Ready For Quantum Cracks
| Wired.com | June 4, 2025
Emerging quantum technologies pose significant risks to current encryption standards, potentially rendering many security protocols obsolete. The challenge lies not only in advancing quantum capabilities but also in developing robust countermeasures to protect sensitive information in a future where quantum attacks are feasible.
44.)
The Rise Of ‚ÄòVibe Hacking‚Äô Is The Next AI Nightmare
| Wired.com | June 4, 2025
The emergence of ‚Äòvibe hacking‚Äô signals a potential shift in cybercrime, allowing inexperienced hackers to leverage AI tools for advanced attacks. With generative AI enhancing coding capabilities, the cybersecurity landscape may soon face unprecedented challenges as sophisticated actors combine their skills with new technology.
45.)
Why AI Isn‚Äôt Delivering: Key Findings From Coastal‚Äôs 2025 AI Report
| CoastalCloud.us | June 4, 2025
Despite increasing investment in AI, many organizations struggle to achieve measurable ROI. Common barriers include outdated infrastructure and a lack of cohesive data strategies, with a pressing need for modernization to leverage AI effectively.
46.)
AI Summarizers Analysis: Test Documents And Books
| WashingtonPost.com | June 4, 2025
The exploration of AI summarizers has gained traction as researchers test their effectiveness on various documents and books. Results show significant advancements in the capability of these AI systems to condense lengthy texts while maintaining essential information, raising questions about their practical applications in education and professional settings.
47.)
Figma Launches Dev Mode MCP Server To Enhance LLM Code Generation Workflows
| Figma.com | June 4, 2025
Until recently, the only way to provide design context to AI tools was to feed an image of a design or an API response to a chatbot. This has changed with the recent advent of Model Context Protocol (MCP), a standard for how applications provide context to LLMs. We set out to apply this standard with Figma‚Äôs Dev Mode MCP server, which allows developers to bring context from Figma into agentic coding tools like Copilot in VS Code, Cursor, Windsurf, and Claude Code. Whether it‚Äôs creating new atomic components with the proper variables and stylings or building out multi-layer application flows, we believe this server will provide a more efficient and accurate design-to-code workflow.
48.)
Hubspot Integrates ChatGPT For Advanced Crm Research Capabilities
| MarTech.org | June 4, 2025
HubSpot announced today the launch of a deep research connector with ChatGPT. More than 75% of HubSpot customers are already using ChatGPT, according to HubSpot‚Äôs Q1 2025 AI customer sentiment survey. Using the new deep research connector, those customers will be able to apply powerful research and analysis to their own customer data and context.
49.)
Reddit Sues Anthropic Over Alleged Unauthorized Bot Access Over 100,000 Times
| TheVerge.com | June 4, 2025
Reddit sued Anthropic on Wednesday in San Francisco superior court, claiming that the OpenAI rival had accessed its platform more than 100,000 times since July 2024, after Anthropic allegedly said it had blocked its bots from doing so.
50.)
Mistral Launches ‚ÄòVibe Coding‚Äô Client Mistral Code To Compete With Github Copilot
| TechCrunch.com | June 4, 2025
French AI startup Mistral is releasing its own ‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù client, Mistral Code, to compete with incumbents like Windsurf, Anysphere‚Äôs Cursor, and GitHub Copilot.
51.)
Anthropic Now Offers Claude Code Access To Claude Pro Subscribers
| Support.anthropic.com | June 4, 2025
Pro and Max plan subscribers have access to use Claude Code directly in the terminal.
52.)
Epic Games Expands Fortnite With Creator-Made AI Characters
| TheVerge.com | June 4, 2025
AI Darth Vader was a huge hit in Fortnite, and now Epic plans to let creators make AI-powered NPCs for their own in-game experiences. But a senior Epic exec says that creators should expect a ‚Äúlearning curve‚Äù when using them ‚Äî something Epic had to figure out on its own.
53.)
Samsung Unveils Next-Gen Ultra With Enhanced Features And Compact Design
| SamsungMobilePress.com | June 4, 2025
For years, Samsung has listened to users asking for bigger screens, better cameras and new ways to connect and create. The demand is clear ‚Äî an Ultra-experience that goes beyond a simple list of upgraded features in a smaller and more portable form factor.
54.)
OpenAI Introduces ChatGPT Enterprise With Deep Research, Record Mode, And Custom Data Connectors
| OpenAI.com | June 4, 2025
Connectors to internal tools, custom connectors with MCP, ChatGPT record mode, and flexible pricing.
55.)
Runway Partners With AMC Networks For AI-Enhanced Marketing And TV Development
| RunwayML.com | June 4, 2025
Runway and AMC Networks, the international entertainment company known for popular and award-winning titles including Mad Men, Breaking Bad, Better Call Saul, The Walking Dead and Anne Rice‚Äôs Interview With The Vampire, are partnering to incorporate Runway‚Äôs AI models and tools in AMC Networks‚Äô marketing and TV development processes.
56.)
Cursor AI Launches Cursor 1.0 With Advanced Code Review And Multi-Tasking Features
| X.com | June 4, 2025
Cursor 1.0 is out now! Cursor can now review your code, remember its mistakes, and work on dozens of tasks in the background.
57.)
Microsoft Copilot Launches AI-Powered Shopping Assistant For Smarter Deals
| X.com | June 4, 2025
Your shopping sidekick has arrived. Smarter finds, better deals, and tailored picks ‚Äî all in one place.
58.)
Pymnts.Com: Voice AI Funding Jumps 8X As Companies Adopt Humanized Chatbots
| Pymnts.com | June 4, 2025
A revolution is underway in customer communication, and it‚Äôs being led not by keyboards or screens ‚Äî but by voices. Voice-based artificial intelligence (AI) agents, long a promise more than a product, are advancing to such a degree that they are now outperforming call centers and beginning to replace human labor in industries from healthcare to retail, according to venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz.
59.)
OpenAI Challenges Court Order To Store All ChatGPT Logs Including Deleted Chats
| ArsTechnica.com | June 4, 2025
OpenAI is now fighting a court order to preserve all ChatGPT user logs ‚Äî including deleted chats and sensitive chats logged through its API business offering ‚Äî after news organizations suing over copyright claims accused the AI company of destroying evidence.
60.)
OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Gains Real-Time Context Access To Multiple Internal Sources For Select Users
| X.com | June 4, 2025
ChatGPT can now connect to more internal sources & pull in real-time context ‚Äî keeping existing user-level permissions. Connectors available in deep research for Plus & Pro users (excl. EEA, CH, UK) and Team, Enterprise & Edu users: Outlook, Teams, Google, Drive, Gmail, Linear, & more.
61.)
Luma AI Unveils Modify Video: Transform Style, Character, And Setting With Ease
| X.com | June 4, 2025
Introducing Modify Video. Reimagine any video. Shoot it in post with director-grade control over style, character, and setting. Restyle expressive performances, swap entire worlds, or redesign the frame to your vision. Shoot once. Shape infinitely.
June 3, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
62.)
AI Skills = 56% Pay Bump
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 3, 2025
A recent PwC study reveals that employees with AI skills are experiencing significant wage increases, with a 56% premium for those skilled in prompt engineering. Additionally, companies are leveraging AI to enhance employee productivity rather than simply reducing headcount, fostering new job growth and redefined roles.
63.)
Prompt Engineering Guide ‚Äì From Beginner to Advanced
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 3, 2025
Explore the evolving field of prompt engineering, where beginners can transition to advanced techniques that effectively harness AI capabilities. Gain insights into practical applications, tools, and strategies that enhance interaction with AI systems, making the most of prompt-based technologies.
64.)
How Big Tech Got Scammed By An ‚ÄòAI‚Äô
| SlideBean | YouTube.com | June 3, 2025
Builder.ai‚Äôs $450M funding claim created the illusion of AI, but human efforts stood at the core, showcasing the rise of ‚ÄúAI-washing.‚Äù Explore the stark contradictions in tech startups as they grapple with authenticity and investor trust in an age of rapid technological claims.
65.)
Microsoft VP Explains AI PCs + Satya Nadella on Healthcare AI
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | June 3, 2025
Matt Wolfe engages with Pavan Davuluri, Microsoft‚Äôs Corporate VP, to explore how AI PCs will redefine personal computing with advanced technologies like NPUs. The conversation delves into the implications for user privacy, local AI processing, and features such as Microsoft Recall, alongside insights from CEO Satya Nadella on the future of AI in healthcare.
66.)
2-Year-Old Becomes Youngest Mensa Member Ever
| Vice.com | June 3, 2025
At just 2 years and 182 days old, Joseph Harris-Birtill has become the youngest person ever admitted to Mensa, qualifying for membership by demonstrating extraordinary developmental milestones. His parents, both academics, recognized his remarkable intellect and pursued Mensa membership after witnessing his advanced abilities in reading, counting, and even learning Morse code.
67.)
State Lawmakers Push Back On Federal Proposal To Limit AI Regulation
| StateScoop.com | June 3, 2025
More than 260 state legislators from all 50 states have expressed opposition to a ten-year moratorium in a federal budget bill that would restrict state and local regulation of artificial intelligence.
